para.text: It is possible to modify a

once it has been defined and has classes that conform to it. Providing the protocol is unlocked, it is possible to add selectors and remove selectors and it is also possible to change the list of conforming classes. The various operations can be performed using the context menus in the

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:14px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:14px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.46; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: The important thing to note when modifying a protocol, is that the Dolphin protocol system will attempt to keep all of the conforming classes consistent with its current state. Hence, if you choose to add a selector to an existing protocol, the system will ensure that all conforming classes can respond to this message. In order to do this,
